sentences.en: ‘A shirt would be nice.’ ‘You'll be lucky.’.
sentences.cn: “要是有一件衬衫就好了。”“不大可能吧。”。

sentences.en: "Do these kids know how lucky they are?" Jackson asked rhetorically.
sentences.cn: “这些孩子知道他们有多幸运吗？”杰克逊反问道。

sentences.en: "I'm a lucky man, undeservedly lucky," he said humbly.
sentences.cn: “我是个幸运的人，本不配如此幸运，”他谦虚地说。

sentences.en: "You're unbelievably lucky."— 'What do you mean by that.'
sentences.cn: “你真是太幸运了。”——“你这话是什么意思？”

sentences.en: Chantal was lucky to be able to salvage her career.
sentences.cn: 尚塔尔能保住她的事业算是走了运。

sentences.en: I didn’t really know your name – it was just a lucky guess .
sentences.cn: 我并不知道你的名字―只是运气好猜中的。

sentences.en: I didn’t really know your name – it was just a lucky guess.
sentences.cn: 我并不知道你的名字―只是运气好猜中的。

sentences.en: I'm lucky in that I've got four sisters.
sentences.cn: 我很幸运，因为我有4个姐姐。

sentences.en: If you're lucky, a splendid golden eagle may soar into view.
sentences.cn: 幸运的话，会有一只光彩夺目的金雕飞入你的视野。

sentences.en: In China bats are thought of as being very lucky.
sentences.cn: 在中国，蝙蝠被视为吉祥物。

sentences.en: It was lucky you came along.
Thank your lucky stars you're out of London.
sentences.cn: 你不在伦敦真是走运了。

sentences.en: They admit they are now desperate for a lucky break.
sentences.cn: 他们承认现在急盼幸运之神的降临。

sentences.en: Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
sentences.cn: 老天保佑，我一直很幸运，别的重伤都躲过了。

sentences.en: You'll be lucky if you get any breakfast.
sentences.cn: 你能吃到早饭就已经算幸运了。

sentences.en: You'll be lucky to have change out of £750.
sentences.cn: 你的750英镑要是还有的剩就真是运气了。

words.tran_cn: 运气；幸运；带来好运的东西

phrases.phrase: lucky devil (或 lucky you, her，等)
phrases.tran_cn: 幸运的家伙（表达对别人好运的嫉妒）

phrases.phrase: you (或 he等) will be lucky (或 should be so lucky)

trans.tran_cn: 运气好的，侥幸的，兆头好的，吉祥的，〈俚〉难得，很恰当的
